definitions.body: :Le 26:26 portable stove or fire-pot (loan-word from As. tinûru, id., acc. to DHM:VOJ i. 23 (otherwise Dvořák:ZK i. 155 ff.); ´[[ת]]:, a large earthen jar, still in Syria, Wetzst:Verhandl. d. Berl. Anthrop. Gesell., 1882, 467 Whitehouse:Heb. Antiq. 7, 3 ARSK:EB l. 605; Ar. tan=uwrun is loan-word from Aram. [[תַּנּוּרָא]], tanuwro0, and this from Pers. tanûra, acc. to Frä:26);—´[[ת]]: abs. Ho 7:4 +, cstr. Ge 15:17, Ps 21:10; pl. [[תַּנּוּרִים]] Ne 3:11, Ne 12:38;—fire-pot, for baking ([[אָפָה]]) Ho 7:4 (read ´[[בּׂעֵר הֵָם אׂפֵהוּ וגו]] :´[[ת]]:, Oort:Th. Tijdschr. 1890, 480 ff. Albr:ZAW xvi (1896), 88), cf. v:Ho 7:6, v:Ho 7:7; (all in sim.), Ex 7:28 (J), Le 2:4, Le 7:9, Le 26:26 (P), also (breakable) Le 11:35; [[עָשָׁן]] ´[[ת]]: Ge 15:17 (JE) in vision, symbol of ´[[י]]:’s presence, cf. Is 31:9 (‖[[אוּר ]]); sim. of heat La 5:10, of judgment Mal 3:19, and so [[אֵשׁ]] ´[[ת]]: Ps 21:10; [[מִגְדַּל הַתַּנּוּרִים]] Ne 3:11, Ne 12:38 a tower on wall of Jerus.
